DataElement.preferredDefinition: A non-unique textual identifier for the person. EXAMPLE(S): proper name, nickname, legal name

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single human being.:Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving)._Personal names, given or surname, as cultural characteristics, as ethnological or religious patterns, as indications of the geographic distribution of families and inbreeding, etc. Analysis of isonymy, the quality of having the same or similar names, is useful in the study of population genetics. NAMES is used also for the history of names or name changes of corporate bodies, such as medical societies, universities, hospitals, government agencies, etc.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A single human being.:Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.
An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).

Property.preferredDefinition: Personal names, given or surname, as cultural characteristics, as ethnological or religious patterns, as indications of the geographic distribution of families and inbreeding, etc. Analysis of isonymy, the quality of having the same or similar names, is useful in the study of population genetics. NAMES is used also for the history of names or name changes of corporate bodies, such as medical societies, universities, hospitals, government agencies, etc.

Concepts.definition: A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval.  mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A collection containing unordered distinct/discrete values of the type EN.PN.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
